trial_identification.studytitle: The use of bronchodilators in people with recently acquired spinal cord injury
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of bronchodilators on respiratory function of people with recently acquired spinal cord injury

conditions.healthcondition: acute spinal cord injury and effects of bronchodilators on spirometry measures

interventions.interventions: Subjects in the treatment group will receive 4 puffs of salbutamol (ventolin)via a spacer. Subjects in the control group will 4 puffs of placebo salbutamol administered in the same way. Both the salbutamol(ventolin) and placebo will be administered with subjects in lying using a fspacer Subjects will not be told whether they are receiving the experimental or sham condition .Within the next week experimental subjects will receive the placebo and control subjects will receive the salbutamol (ventolin) using the same procedure as outline above. In this way, subjects will act as their own controls.Minimum wash out period will be 48 hours. Response to ventolin and placebo will be measured using spirometry and will be compared to a baseline measure of no intervention.
interventions.comparator: placebo ventolin inhaler containing prolpellant only

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in Peak expiratory flow and Forced expiratory volume 1 and Forced Vital Capacity with salbutamol compared to placebo
spirometry (Peak expiratory flow and Forced expiratory volume 1 and Forced Vital Capacity )

secondaryOutcome.outcome: response to ventolin and placebo over 30 minutes measured with spirometry. Patients will be required to perform a forced vital capacity manouvere in supine prior to and then at 10 minutes 30 minutes post administration of ventolin or placebo. Best of three attempts will be taken.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: People with tetraplegia or paraplegia above T4 acquired within 6 weeks of randomisation Motor complete lesion (ie, American Spinal Injuries Association (ASIA)scale A or B with no zones of partial motor preservation) Able to provide informed consent No recent pre morbid history of asthma or premorbid use of bronchodilators not ventilated stable Vital capacity over preceeding 2 days OR stable respiratory status
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Not medically stable, requiring ventilatory support with mechanical ventilation via endothracheal tube or tracheostomy Premorbid recent history of asthma or bronchodilator use

trial_design.concealment: All patients with recently acquired Spinla Cord Injury admitted to the Royal North Shore Hospital will be screened for inclusion.The random allocation will be performed by a person independent to the study and stored off site in opaque sealed sequentially numbered envelopes
trial_design.sequence: Those eligible who provide consent will be randomly allocated to treatment or placebo group .Randomisation performed through random number allocation. Subjects will be allocated after collecting initial data.
